issue.title: Create 'Whole Game' vignette for new instructors

labels.name: priority:high
labels.description: High priority issue that needs immediate attention

issue.body:
## Overview
Create a comprehensive 'Whole Game' vignette that demonstrates the complete workflow for a new instructor analyzing their Zoom class sessions.

## Target User
New instructor who has:
- Zoom transcripts for several sessions of 1 section of 1 class
- Multiple Zoom CSV files saved as they added transcripts to their transcript folder
- A roster of students that needs to be aligned with Zoom transcript names
- Need to identify preferred names and handle name mismatches

## Vignette Requirements

### Complete Workflow Coverage
- [ ] **Setup and Data Preparation**
  - Loading multiple Zoom transcript files
  - Handling multiple CSV files from transcript folder
  - Loading and preparing student roster
  - Initial data exploration and validation

- [ ] **Name Matching and Cleaning**
  - Aligning student roster with Zoom transcript names
  - Identifying and handling preferred names
  - Creating name mapping/lookup tables
  - Handling common name mismatch scenarios

- [ ] **Data Processing and Analysis**
  - Processing multiple transcript sessions
  - Combining data from multiple sources
  - Calculating engagement metrics across sessions
  - Handling missing or incomplete data

- [ ] **Visualization and Insights**
  - Creating meaningful visualizations for instructors
  - Identifying participation patterns
  - Highlighting equitable participation opportunities
  - Generating actionable insights

- [ ] **Best Practices and Tips**
  - Data organization recommendations
  - Common pitfalls and how to avoid them
  - Ethical considerations and privacy
  - Interpreting results for educational improvement

### Technical Requirements
- [ ] Use realistic but anonymized sample data
- [ ] Demonstrate all major package functions
- [ ] Include error handling and troubleshooting
- [ ] Show both basic and advanced features
- [ ] Provide clear step-by-step instructions
- [ ] Include code comments and explanations

### Educational Focus
- [ ] Emphasize equitable participation goals
- [ ] Focus on improving teaching, not surveillance
- [ ] Provide actionable insights for instructors
- [ ] Include pedagogical recommendations
- [ ] Address common instructor concerns

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Complete end-to-end workflow demonstrated
- [ ] All major package functions showcased
- [ ] Clear, beginner-friendly instructions
- [ ] Realistic educational scenarios
- [ ] Ethical use guidelines included
- [ ] Vignette builds and renders correctly
- [ ] Code examples are runnable
- [ ] Documentation is comprehensive

## Priority
HIGH - This would be the primary vignette for new users and is essential for package adoption

## Labels
priority:high, area:documentation, documentation, vignette

issue.title: chore: Update .gitignore and rebuild vignettes with improved formatting
issue.body:
## Summary
Cleanup changes to improve repository organization and vignette formatting.

## Changes
- **Updated .gitignore**: Added  to ignore generated source files
- **Rebuilt vignettes**: Applied improved formatting and whitespace consistency
- **Cleaned up**: Removed untracked generated files from vignettes directory

## Why These Changes
- The generated  files in vignettes/ should not be tracked (they're build artifacts)
- Vignette rebuilding improved formatting consistency
- These are minor but legitimate improvements from the GitHub Pages setup process

## Testing
- All vignettes still build and render correctly
- GitHub Pages deployment continues to work
- No functional changes to package behavior

issue.title: Review functions for ethical use and equitable participation focus

labels.name: ethical
labels.description: Ethical use and equitable participation concerns

issue.body:
## Overview
Review all package functions for potential 'creepiness factor' and ensure the package promotes equitable student participation rather than surveillance or negative bias.

## Background
The goal of this project is to extract useful information about student participation to **encourage equitable participation**, not discourage, hinder, or negatively bias it. We need to ensure our functions support positive educational outcomes.

## Review Criteria

### Ethical Use Assessment
- Review each function for potential misuse scenarios
- Identify functions that could enable surveillance or bias
- Assess whether functions could discourage participation
- Evaluate potential for negative psychological impact on students
- Consider power dynamics between instructors and students

### Equitable Participation Focus
- Ensure functions support inclusive teaching practices
- Verify functions help identify participation gaps \(not individuals\)
- Check that visualizations promote understanding, not judgment
- Review for potential bias in metrics or algorithms
- Assess whether functions support student agency and choice

### Function-by-Function Review

#### Core Processing Functions
- load_zoom_transcript\(\) - Review for privacy implications
- process_zoom_transcript\(\) - Check for potential bias in processing
- summarize_transcript_metrics\(\) - Review metrics for fairness
- summarize_transcript_files\(\) - Assess batch processing ethics

#### Analysis Functions
- plot_users_by_metric\(\) - Review visualization ethics
- plot_users_masked_section_by_metric\(\) - Check anonymization effectiveness
- make_transcripts_summary_df\(\) - Assess summary statistics fairness
- calculate_content_similarity\(\) - Review for potential bias

#### Name Matching Functions
- make_clean_names_df\(\) - Review name matching ethics
- mask_user_names_by_metric\(\) - Verify anonymization quality
- load_roster\(\) - Check roster handling privacy

## Potential Issues to Address

### Surveillance Concerns
- Functions that could enable over-monitoring of individual students
- Metrics that might create pressure or anxiety
- Visualizations that could embarrass or stigmatize students
- Features that might discourage authentic participation

### Bias and Fairness
- Metrics that might favor certain communication styles
- Algorithms that could disadvantage certain student groups
- Visualizations that might reinforce stereotypes
- Functions that could create unfair comparisons

### Privacy and Consent
- Functions that might expose sensitive information
- Features that could violate student privacy expectations
- Data handling that might exceed educational purpose
- Functions that could enable unauthorized surveillance

## Recommendations for Improvement

### Positive Framing
- Reframe metrics as 'participation opportunities' rather than 'performance'
- Focus on group-level insights rather than individual tracking
- Emphasize inclusive teaching strategies
- Promote student agency and choice

### Documentation Updates
- Add ethical use guidelines to documentation
- Include best practices for equitable implementation
- Provide examples of positive educational use
- Warn against potential misuse scenarios

### Function Modifications
- Add privacy warnings where appropriate
- Implement better anonymization features
- Add options for aggregate-only analysis
- Include consent and purpose limitations

## Acceptance Criteria
- All functions reviewed for ethical implications
- Potential misuse scenarios identified and documented
- Functions modified to promote equitable participation
- Documentation includes ethical use guidelines
- Privacy and consent considerations addressed
- Positive educational outcomes emphasized

## Priority
HIGH - Critical for ensuring the package serves its intended educational purpose ethically

## Labels
priority:high, area:core, documentation, ethics, equity

issue.title: Review and implement FERPA/security compliance

labels.name: FERPA
labels.description: FERPA compliance and student data protection

issue.body:
## Overview
Review and implement FERPA compliance and security best practices for handling student data in the zoomstudentengagement package.

## Requirements

### FERPA Compliance
- Review package for FERPA compliance considerations
- Document data privacy requirements
- Implement appropriate data handling procedures
- Add data anonymization features
- Ensure student privacy is protected

### Security Best Practices
- Review code for potential security vulnerabilities
- Implement secure data handling procedures
- Add input validation and sanitization
- Document security considerations
- Review file handling for security issues

### Data Privacy Features
- Implement data anonymization functions
- Add secure data deletion capabilities
- Document data retention policies
- Add privacy notices in documentation
- Implement secure logging practices

## Implementation Tasks
- [ ] Review current code for FERPA compliance
- [ ] Implement data anonymization features
- [ ] Add secure data handling procedures
- [ ] Document privacy and security considerations
- [ ] Add input validation and sanitization
- [ ] Review file handling for security issues
- [ ] Create privacy policy documentation
- [ ] Add security best practices to vignettes
- [ ] Implement secure logging (no sensitive data)
- [ ] Add data retention and deletion features

## Documentation Requirements
- [ ] FERPA compliance guide
- [ ] Security best practices documentation
- [ ] Privacy policy for package users
- [ ] Data handling procedures
- [ ] Security considerations in vignettes

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Package complies with FERPA requirements
- [ ] Security vulnerabilities addressed
- [ ] Data privacy features implemented
- [ ] Comprehensive documentation provided
- [ ] Privacy and security considerations documented

## Priority
HIGH - Critical for handling student data responsibly

## Labels
priority:high, area:core, documentation, FERPA

labels.description: FERPA compliance and student data protection

issue.body:
## Overview
Review and implement FERPA compliance and security best practices for handling student data in the zoomstudentengagement package.

## Requirements

### FERPA Compliance
- Review package for FERPA compliance considerations
- Document data privacy requirements
- Implement appropriate data handling procedures
- Add data anonymization features
- Ensure student privacy is protected

### Security Best Practices
- Review code for potential security vulnerabilities
- Implement secure data handling procedures
- Add input validation and sanitization
- Document security considerations
- Review file handling for security issues

### Data Privacy Features
- Implement data anonymization functions
- Add secure data deletion capabilities
- Document data retention policies
- Add privacy notices in documentation
- Implement secure logging practices

## Implementation Tasks
- [ ] Review current code for FERPA compliance
- [ ] Implement data anonymization features
- [ ] Add secure data handling procedures
- [ ] Document privacy and security considerations
- [ ] Add input validation and sanitization
- [ ] Review file handling for security issues
- [ ] Create privacy policy documentation
- [ ] Add security best practices to vignettes
- [ ] Implement secure logging (no sensitive data)
- [ ] Add data retention and deletion features

## Documentation Requirements
- [ ] FERPA compliance guide
- [ ] Security best practices documentation
- [ ] Privacy policy for package users
- [ ] Data handling procedures
- [ ] Security considerations in vignettes

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Package complies with FERPA requirements
- [ ] Security vulnerabilities addressed
- [ ] Data privacy features implemented
- [ ] Comprehensive documentation provided
- [ ] Privacy and security considerations documented

## Priority
HIGH - Critical for handling student data responsibly

## Labels
priority:high, area:core, documentation, FERPA

issue.title: Test package with real confidential data

labels.name: priority:high
labels.description: High priority issue that needs immediate attention

issue.body:
## Overview
Test the zoomstudentengagement package with real confidential data to validate functionality in production scenarios.

## Requirements
- Test package with actual Zoom transcripts (confidential data)
- Validate all core functions work with real data
- Document any issues or unexpected behavior
- Ensure package handles real-world data formats correctly
- Test performance with larger datasets

## Important Notes
- **DO NOT** run this testing in Cursor/LLM environments
- Use a secure, isolated environment for testing
- Ensure data privacy and confidentiality are maintained
- Document findings without exposing sensitive information

## Testing Checklist
- [ ] Load and process real Zoom transcripts
- [ ] Test name matching with actual student rosters
- [ ] Validate engagement metrics calculations
- [ ] Test visualization functions with real data
- [ ] Check performance with larger files
- [ ] Document any bugs or issues found
- [ ] Verify data privacy features work correctly

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Package successfully processes real Zoom transcripts
- [ ] All core functions work as expected with real data
- [ ] No data privacy or security issues identified
- [ ] Performance is acceptable for typical use cases
- [ ] Documentation updated based on findings

## Priority
HIGH - Critical for validating package functionality before CRAN submission

## Labels
priority:high, area:testing, enhancement, CRAN:submission

issue.title: feat: Create comprehensive package vignettes
issue.body:
Closes #45

## Summary
This PR creates comprehensive vignettes to enhance package usability and meet CRAN requirements.

## Changes
- Created 5 vignettes covering all major workflows:
  - Getting Started: Basic setup and workflow overview
  - Transcript Processing: Load, process, and analyze transcripts  
  - Roster Management: Manage student rosters and clean name mismatches
  - Plotting and Analysis: Create visualizations and analyze engagement patterns
  - Session Mapping: Handle complex scenarios with multiple courses/sections

## Acceptance Criteria Met
- [x] All vignettes build without errors
- [x] Examples are runnable and demonstrate key functionality
- [x] Vignettes are linked from README.md
- [x] Vignettes follow R package vignette best practices
- [x] Content is clear and accessible to target users

## Additional Improvements
- Fixed memory exhaustion issues in load_zoom_transcript function
- Resolved type mismatches and design inconsistencies in session mapping
- Updated README with comprehensive vignette links
- Enhanced overall package documentation

## Testing
- All 453 tests pass (0 failures)
- Package builds successfully
- Vignettes render without errors
- No critical R CMD check issues

issue.title: fix: Resolve Issue #58 - Fix missing example data CRAN blocker
issue.body:
## Summary
Fixes GitHub Issue #58 - CRAN submission blocker due to missing example data.

## Changes Made
- Fixed 5 functions with missing data object references
- Added \dontrun{} wrappers for examples requiring external data
- Added runnable examples to 4 functions for better user experience
- Implemented hybrid approach (simple + complex examples)
- Updated PROJECT.md to reflect completion

## Functions Fixed
- create_session_mapping - Wrapped complex example in \dontrun{}
- join_transcripts_list - Wrapped example in \dontrun{} for external data
- make_students_only_transcripts_summary_df - Wrapped example in \dontrun{}
- load_session_mapping - Wrapped example in \dontrun{}
- plot_users_by_metric - Added simple runnable example + kept complex example in \dontrun{}

## Verification
- All examples pass R CMD check (checking examples ... OK)
- No missing data object errors
- Package ready for CRAN submission from examples perspective
- Full pre-CRAN development workflow completed successfully

## Documentation
- Created comprehensive audit reports (EXAMPLES_AUDIT_REPORT.md)
- Analyzed \dontrun{} usage (DONTRUN_ANALYSIS.md)
- Documented remaining examples (REMAINING_EXAMPLES_ANALYSIS.md)
- Updated issue plan with completion status

## Pre-CRAN Validation Results
- ✅ Code Quality: styler::style_pkg() - All files unchanged
- ✅ Documentation: devtools::document() - Updated successfully
- ✅ README: devtools::build_readme() - Built successfully
- ✅ Spelling: devtools::spell_check() - No errors found
- ✅ Testing: devtools::test() - 453 tests passing, 0 failures
- ✅ Coverage: covr::package_coverage() - 83.40% coverage
- ✅ Final Check: devtools::check() - 0 errors, 0 warnings, 2 notes
- ✅ Build: devtools::build() - Package builds successfully

Fixes #58

issue.title: Fix missing example data in function documentation

labels.name: priority:high
labels.description: High priority issue that needs immediate attention

issue.body:
## Summary

Function examples are failing because required data objects are not defined or available.

## Current Issues

### Example Failures
- create_session_mapping() example fails: object 'zoom_recordings' not found
- Multiple functions have examples that reference undefined objects

### Root Cause
Documentation examples were not properly tested after recent changes, and example datasets are missing.

## Specific Problems

### 1. Missing Data Objects
- zoom_recordings object not defined in create_session_mapping examples
- Other functions may have similar issues

### 2. Affected Functions
- create_session_mapping() - Primary example failure
- Potentially other functions with complex examples

### 3. Impact
- Examples fail during R CMD check
- Blocks CRAN submission
- Poor user experience

## Proposed Solution

1. Audit all function examples for missing data
2. Create proper example datasets
3. Update examples to use available data
4. Test all examples locally
5. Ensure examples are self-contained

## Acceptance Criteria

- All function examples run without errors
- Example data is properly defined and available
- Examples demonstrate realistic use cases
- No hardcoded paths or system-specific code
- All examples pass R CMD check

## Priority
HIGH - This blocks CRAN submission

## Related Issues
- Related to documentation updates (#19)
- Blocks CRAN submission
- Part of CRAN compliance (#21)

issue.title: fix: Update .Rbuildignore to resolve R CMD check notes
issue.body:
## Summary

This PR addresses GitHub Issue #72 by updating the .Rbuildignore file to comprehensively exclude non-standard files that were causing R CMD check notes.

## Changes Made

- Added comprehensive patterns for hidden files and directories
- Included .git/, .Rproj.user/, and additional system files
- Added patterns for development documentation files
- Enhanced coverage for temporary and build artifacts

## Testing

- Verified that R CMD build creates a clean package
- Confirmed R CMD check passes with Status: OK (0 warnings, 0 notes)
- All hidden files and non-portable file paths are now properly excluded

## Impact

- Resolves CRAN submission blocker (Issue #72)
- Eliminates R CMD check notes about non-standard files
- Ensures clean package builds for distribution

Fixes #72

issue.title: Fix: Restore passing test suite and clean up test warnings

milestone.title: Test Suite Cleanup
milestone.description: Target: January 2025 - Fix test warnings and ensure all tests pass

issue.body:
## Summary
The test suite currently has issues that need to be addressed. This includes both general test suite restoration and specific test warnings that should be cleaned up.

## Current Test Warnings
The tests for  currently produce warnings about conditions with length > 1. These warnings occur in multiple test files:
- test-make_clean_names_df.R
- test-name-matching.R
- test-plotting_functions.R

### Current Behavior
When running tests, we see warnings like:


This occurs because  in  can return vectors of length > 1, and the test assertions are not explicitly handling this case.

### Expected Behavior
Tests should run without warnings, properly handling vector lengths in all assertions.

## Proposed Solution
1. Review all test assertions in affected files
2. Update assertions to explicitly handle vector lengths where needed
3. Consider using  or similar to handle vectorized operations
4. Add explicit length checks in assertions
5. Update test documentation to clarify expected behavior

## Files to Modify

issue.title: Generalize Topic parsing in load_zoom_recorded_sessions_list to only extract section and optionally dept
issue.body:
The current implementation of load_zoom_recorded_sessions_list parses the Topic field to extract dept, section, day, time, and instructor. However, only section (and optionally dept for filtering) are required downstream.

This issue proposes to generalize the Topic parsing to robustly extract only section (and optionally dept), making the function resilient to changes in the Topic format. The regex should match the dept and section at the start of the Topic string, regardless of what follows.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Only section (and optionally dept) are extracted from Topic.
- The function works for both old and new Topic formats (e.g., 'LTF 101 - Mon 10:00 (Dr. Smith)' and 'DATASCI 201.006: RDADA Live Session').
- If section cannot be extracted, set it to NA and optionally warn the user.
- Update documentation to reflect the new behavior.

issue.title: Optimize GitHub Actions workflow for faster dependency installation
issue.body:
## Current Issue
The R-CMD-check workflow is taking too long to install dependencies (7+ minutes), which slows down the development process.

## Proposed Solution
Implement optimizations to the GitHub Actions workflow as outlined in PROJECT.md:

### 1. Package Caching
- [ ] Implement R package caching using `actions/cache`
- [ ] Cache both CRAN and GitHub packages
- [ ] Set appropriate cache keys and paths

### 2. Dependency Management
- [ ] Replace manual dependency installation with `r-lib/actions/setup-r-dependencies@v2`
- [ ] Configure to install only necessary dependencies
- [ ] Use `dependencies: c("Depends", "Imports", "LinkingTo")` instead of `TRUE`

### 3. System Dependencies
- [ ] Cache system package installations
- [ ] Optimize apt-get update/install commands
- [ ] Consider using pre-built Docker images

### 4. Workflow Structure
- [ ] Separate dependency installation from testing
- [ ] Use matrix builds for different R versions
- [ ] Implement conditional steps based on changes

### 5. Monitoring
- [ ] Add timing information to workflow steps
- [ ] Track cache hit rates
- [ ] Monitor workflow performance metrics

## Implementation Steps
1. Create new branch for workflow optimization
2. Update R-CMD-check.yaml with optimized configuration
3. Test workflow performance
4. Document optimization results
5. Create pull request with changes

## Expected Benefits
- Reduced workflow execution time
- More reliable dependency installation
- Better resource utilization
- Improved developer experience

## References
- [r-lib/actions documentation](https://github.com/r-lib/actions)
- [GitHub Actions caching](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-workflows/caching-dependencies-to-speed-up-workflows)
- [R package development workflow](https://r-pkgs.org/whole-game.html)

issue.title: Cross-reference issues and track progress in AUDIT_LOG.md
issue.body: As each issue is created, add its number/link to the relevant checklist item in AUDIT_LOG.md. As each subtask is completed, update the log with dates, decisions, and outcomes.

issue.title: Update NEWS.md, tests, README, and vignettes for all API changes
issue.body: Document all breaking changes, renames, and deprecations in NEWS.md. Update or add tests to match new function names, arguments, and behaviors. Update all usage examples in README and vignettes to match the new API.

issue.title: Ensure all tabular outputs are tibbles and document return types
issue.body: All functions that return tabular data should return a tibble. Document the structure of the returned object in the roxygen2 docs.

issue.title: Internalize helper/utility functions not intended for export
issue.body: Make any function not intended for end users internal (not exported). Prefix with a dot (e.g., .helper_function) if desired.

issue.title: Update and complete roxygen2 documentation for all exported functions
issue.body: Ensure all exported functions have comprehensive roxygen2 documentation: Description, Arguments (with types and defaults), Return value, Examples (including edge cases), @export tag. Use the @deprecated tag for any functions being phased out.

issue.title: Standardize argument names and order
issue.body: Standardize argument names and order: Use data or df as the first argument for all functions that operate on a data frame/tibble. Use descriptive names for multiple data frames (e.g., roster_df, session_df). Avoid abbreviations unless standard (e.g., df). Ensure data argument is first, followed by parameters, then optional arguments with defaults.

issue.title: Standardize function prefixes for consistency
issue.body: Standardize function prefixes for consistency: Use create_ or make_ for new objects, summarize_ for aggregations, filter_ for subsetting, join_ for merges, load_ for data loading, write_ for data writing, plot_ for plotting, process_ for transformations.

issue.title: Refactor verbose or unclear function names (e.g., make_students_only_transcripts_summary_df)
issue.body: Rename make_students_only_transcripts_summary_df to a more concise, descriptive name (e.g., summarize_enrolled_students()). Review all make_ functions and consider if create_, summarize_, filter_, or join_ would be clearer. Ensure all function names follow tidyverse conventions (verbs, clarity, no unnecessary acronyms).

issue.title: Remove or deprecate demo/legacy functions (hello, load_and_process_zoom_transcript)
issue.body: Remove hello from exports (not part of the package API). Remove or fully deprecate load_and_process_zoom_transcript (ensure it is not in NAMESPACE and is clearly marked as deprecated in documentation). Update NEWS.md to document these changes.

- Ensure all exported functions have complete roxygen2 documentation
